parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From a derivative of muo; a secret or 'mystery'.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: From keimai; to put to sleep, i.e. to slumber; figuratively, to decease.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To change, alter, exchange, transform. From allos; to make different.
